article_node.title: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Mostly Low Prices
article_node.summary:
Stocks fell again. The S&P 500 notched its fifth consecutive decline on Thursday, losing 0.4% by the closing bell. The Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite both slipped 0.3% for the day. Most megacap tech stocks closed another day in the red, bringing their average loss so far this week to 3.7%.

Walmart felt the tariff heat. The retail giant said Thursday that its scale has allowed it to keep its tariff-related price hikes below the national average. But the shares still fell as earnings came i...
